title: language translate and storage
content: There is some worst problem with Firefox for android's management of storage data. When I click on translate a page, it download some pack of the source/target languages and keeps it in app's data permanently. The language also does not show as been downloaded in the translate setting section. Unwantedly firefox consumes persistent storage only for just after we randomly to translate a page from a random language and firefox android download unwanted languge's pack and event does not show in downloaded languages. No way to clean the storage apark from "clear data" which we do not want to do ! Same happens when you have an incognito session with multiple tabs open, and the system closes Firefox when you open some other apps. Firefox loses track of the "potentially to be deleted" data. Firefox data increased forever after such a Hard closed session.(in low RAM device 3-4GB). No other option except to Clear Firefox's data!
creator: coolbrijeshrana

title: I'm unable to figure out how to transfer my Bookmarked Favorates and Pictures, Documents,and music folders and files  from my Google Chrome web browser?
content:
I have no idea what passwords from . csv.files are or where to find them on my Asus LinuxMint laptop? 

 The only password and username that i entered into my LinuxLaptop  are the only usernames and passwords

that I've entered into my new computer. I've also entered my google Chrome username and password to set up my Thunderbird email service. I never wanted to sync all my usernames and passwords in my Acer laptop computer because I felt that that made it too simple for a hacker to access all of my personal Information and access to accounts. Mozilla Firefox wants a password for csv files or tsv files or HTML files ? I don' know what any of these files are or where to go to to find them or the passwords for these files. I just want to successfully transfer all of my Favorates folders and files then all my Documents and picture files to my new computer. I'm a Photography artist, Graphic Designer,abstract painter, and creative writer. I can't move forward in my creative pursuits without completing these tasks. Thanks very much for your help and information. I'm soon to be 80 years old and not a very good keypuncher on a computer. I'm happy to leave Microsoft Windows and Google behind but Linux Mint is all new to me.
creator: Unchainyourmind83

title: Error logging in to account.apple.com - Failed to verify your identity!
content:
I'm unable to login to account.apple.com on my laptop which is running Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS.

I've launched Firefox using the `-p` option, created a new profile and then navigated to https://account.apple.com/sign-in and tried to login. I've attached a screenshot of the error message.

I had tried multiple things on my default profile, even troubleshoot mode, but I couldn't get it. I even tried useragent switcher to no avail.

I can login to the site using Chromium.

What else can I try?
creator: ak.mozilla
